description: Details required by condition 4 (Construction Management Plan) of planning permission 19/01717/FUL (Variation of condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of planning permission 18/12951/FUL (Demolition of existing dwelling and garage. Erection of replacement dwelling consisting of lower ground floor/basement, 3 further floors and attached garage) to include a reduction in the overall footprint and changes to windows and openings)
decision_conditions: The details submitted for 4 (Construction Management Plan) of planning permission 19/01717/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory and this condition is hereby fully discharged.

The site comprises a semi-detached dwelling.Fourteen neighbouring properties have been notified and no representations have been received.This application follows a previous application for the demolition of existing garage and erection of two storey side extension which was permited with condition on 14/06/2006 (06/16198/FUL) but has since expired.The key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.- The impact of the development on ParkingWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: The proposed development is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.Policy DM9 of the Council's LDF Core Strategy (2012) states that new development must comply with local car parking standards in order that it does not contribute to congestion or compromise highway safety.  Policy DM10 supports this stance. Officer Comment: Despite the loss of the existing garage, it is considered that the hardstanding to the front of the dwelling remains of an adequate size to accommodate three off street car parking spaces, therefore the proposal would comply with the Policy DM9 and DM10.In conclusion, the proposed development would accord with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2016) Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).
